basics.name: Jean-Loup Caillet
basics.label: Space Simulators Architect
basics.summary: Experienced Space Simulator Architect passionate about innovation and emerging technologies. Looking for new challenges.

work.name: U-Space
work.summary: Design, implement and develop software architecture for nanosatellite simulators.
highlights: Create a fully responsive simulator structure with HITL (+Numerical)
responsibilities: Communicate with users and clients to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Define software requirements alongside the product owner, users, and development teams.
Design software architectures by selecting appropriate technologies, defining interconnections, and producing the corresponding documentation.
Conduct feasibility studies and develop proof-of-concept prototypes to assess the viability of IT projects.
Draft detailed specifications based on user needs and inputs, along with a development roadmap for the IT system.
Write clean, maintainable source code that complies with development standards and software engineering best practices.
Contribute (when applicable) to hardware development interfacing with the developed software.
Define the technical roadmap and ensure its feasibility and execution.
Define test and validation strategies for the IT system and its interfaces with other systems.
Validate and analyze system functionality and performance.
Define and implement IT system security and data privacy policies.
Plan and manage the maintenance and evolution of the IT system.
Produce comprehensive technical and user documentation for the system.
Ensure software quality, performance, and compliance with business requirements and development standards.
Identify and resolve bugs and anomalies in both development and production environments.
Deploy the system, train users, and provide support either internally or at the client site.
Monitor system evolution and integrate new technologies as needed.
Collaborate with other developers and space engineers, work as part of a team, and provide technical expertise to fellow developers.
Lead software development in project mode by providing regular updates on progress, risks (technical and human), and blocking issues.
Work in agile mode in collaboration with users, focusing on individual interactions, delivering in sprints, and adapting to changes.
achievements: Developed around thirty hybrid simulators with varied functionalities: mission-specific, generic, and multi-purpose.
Delivered a cost-effective and easily deployable software base for flight software development.
Provided complete simulation systems—including platform and ground segment simulators—for satellite operations training.
Participated in the LEOP (Launch and Early Orbit Phase) of multiple satellites.
Provided expertise and support in various subsystems: EPS (Electrical Power System), Thermal, GNSS, GNC (Guidance, Navigation & Control), RF, and so on...
Delivered end-to-end systems to various clients (HITL and on premise), from design to operational deployment.
Designed electronic boards for avionics test benches.
Integration of the ground-system simulator in a clean room with several satellites (PFM) for rehearsal tests.

work.name: CS for CNES
work.summary: Participate in the development of satellite constellation phasing and station-keeping algorithms, with a view to enriching flight dynamics algorithms database (SIRIUS) for CNES
highlights: Contributed to the success of the constellation mission
responsibilities: Monitoring and validate flight dynamics's algorithms (SIRIUS)
Technical support for multi satellite station keeping (FR: MAP)
Operational support for multi satellite positioning (FR: MIP)
Help to the Flight Dynamic System product's validation (FDS)
Participation in system trials for product validation (FDS) and mission requirements. (MultisatPhasing, StationKeeping, AOCS...)
achievements: Successfully led the implementation of station-keeping algorithms and the validation of multi-phasing algorithms for satellites.

Designed and executed over fifty test scenarios during QO (Operational Qualification), QT (Qualification Testing), and RG (General Repetitions) phases to validate all systems, including programming, orbitography, and maneuver planning.
Performed satellite operations, including constellation deployment, acting as maneuver lead.
Oversaw station-keeping operations for the constellation, serving as maneuver lead.

work.name: CNES
work.position: Flight Sofware validation for the Nanosatellite Eyesat
work.summary: Contributing to the validation of various flight software partitions for the EyeSat nanosatellite on an avionics test bench
highlights: Validate the AOCS algorithms of the LV, develop the power architecture and thermal chain
Interfacing the bench with the control centre and the numerical simulator

projects.name: Osinter
projects.description: An OSINTer is an open-source intelligence practitioner who gathers, analyzes, and interprets publicly available information to uncover insights for security, investigative, or strategic purposes.

projects.name: CTF (HSR)
projects.description: A CTF (Capture The Flag) is a competitive cybersecurity challenge where participants solve tasks in areas like cryptography, reverse engineering, and exploitation to find hidden 'flags' and score points.
highlights: Creation of various challenges (Crypto, Forensic, Steg, Osint..)

projects.name: Publication
projects.description: Quick compensatory mechanisms for tongue posture stabilization during speech production.
highlights: Participation in analysis of initial results
